abstract: The home of Bradley H. Jack, the former Lehman Brothers banking chief who has been arrested twice for allegedly forging drug prescriptions, may be sold at auction after he failed to pay property taxes. Bloomberg News reports Mr. Jack owes $271,923 on his 20-acre waterfront house in Fairfield, Conn.

headline.main: The Tax Man Cometh for a Former Lehman Banker
